intro: Marlierea choriophylla, commonly known as the golden leaf plant, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow-green leaves and showy pink or purple flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade. Marlierea choriophylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant.
